page.title: 08Old People's Home S.on A.
page.content: Health. Tiddington Fields is a purpose built old people's home.There are 32 single rooms and 15 double.They do have facilities for married couples but these are very few because women live longer than men.Of the 60 people in the Home only 12 are men.Payment is according to what one can afford. Social Services and the County Council pay the rest.The guests are encouraged to bring their own belongings and furniture.There is a dining room but most people have breakfast in bed and supper in their own room.There are 4 lounges and a visitors'lounge.Guests may visit their friends at any time. Special facilities include a lift,hand rails and Parker baths.All the laundry is done on the premises and there is a clinic and hair dressing salon to cater for those who cannot go out.A minibus will enable outings.
